title: Gordon's putback slam beats buzzer, sinks Clips
content: Aaron Gordon's putback dunk just beat the final buzzer Saturday, giving the Nuggets a dramatic 101-99 win over the Clippers after Denver squandered a 22-point lead.

title: Browns end Sanders' slide, pick QB in 5th round
content: The Browns traded up in the fifth round Saturday and selected quarterback Shedeur Sanders at No. 144 overall, ending the Colorado star's NFL draft free fall.

title: Minus Butler, Curry, Dubs get tough in pivotal win
content: Stephen Curry had 36 points, and the Warriors delivered perhaps their gutsiest performance of the season in a 104-93 win to take a 2-1 series lead over the Rockets.

title: D-backs' Suarez slugs four HRs in loss to Braves
content: Diamondbacks third baseman Eugenio Suarez became the 19th player in major league history to hit four home runs in a game Saturday night, doing so against the Braves.

title: Steelers, waiting on Rodgers, draft QB Howard
content: The Steelers selected Ohio State's Will Howard with the 185th pick in the sixth round Saturday, adding a quarterback to their depth chart while they continue to wait on an answer from Aaron Rodgers.

title: Landeskog scores 1st NHL goal in nearly 3 years
content: Playing in just his second game this season and with his team facing a 2-1 series deficit, Colorado Avalanche captain Gabriel Landeskog scored his first NHL goal in nearly three years during his club's 4-0 Game 4 victory over the Dallas Stars on Saturday.

title: Ravens draft kicker with Tucker's future uncertain
content: The Ravens drafted a kicker for the first time in their team history, which creates more uncertainty surrounding Justin Tucker's future in Baltimore.

title: Dolphins: QB Ewers 'made sense' in 7th round
content: The Dolphins selected Texas quarterback Quinn Ewers with the 231st pick in the seventh round Saturday.

title: Browns gamble on Shedeur Sanders after drafting Dillon Gabriel: What's the plan?
content: Answering the biggest questions surrounding Cleveland's selection of Sanders in the fifth round, including reaction from around the league.

title: Barça's Copa del Rey win shows Madrid have more to worry about than referees
content: Barcelona's Clasico supremacy continues, pushing rivals Real Madrid to the brink of a trophyless season.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: 'He's a great leader': Cam Ward displays leadership abilities in texts to Titans draftees
content: The No. 1 pick in the 2025 NFL draft wasted no time building a rapport with his fellow Titans rookies.

title: Yamal: Madrid can't handle Copa-winning Barça
content: Lamine Yamal says Real Madrid can't handle Barcelona this season after Hansi Flick's side came from behind to beat their Clásico rivals and win the Copa del Rey on Saturday.

title: Reynolds, Wrexham eye PL after historic promotion
content: Ryan Reynolds said Wrexham are targeting the Premier League after the Hollywood-owned club secured a historic third-successive promotion to claim a place in the EFL Championship.

title: Madrid have 3 sent off in testy end to Copa final
content: Jude Bellingham, Antonio Rüdiger and Lucas Vázquez were all shown red cards in the dramatic closing stages of Real Madrid's 3-2 extra-time defeat to Barcelona in the Copa del Rey final on Saturday.

title: Courage end KC's perfect start with stunning win
content: The previously winless North Carolina Courage scored twice in the final minutes of the game to hand the first-place Kansas City Current their first loss of the NWSL season on Saturday.

title: Amorim: 'No regrets' about taking Man Utd job
content: Ruben Amorim said he has "no regrets" about taking the Manchester United job but added he had to shake off doubts about the timing of his appointment.

title: Kane suspended for Bayern's title-winning game
content: Harry Kane will miss Bayern Munich's Bundesliga match against RB Leipzig next Saturday due to suspension.

title: Ronaldo goal leads Al Nassr into Asian CL semis
content: Cristiano Ronaldo led Saudi Arabian team Al-Nassr to a 4-1 win over Yokohama F. Marinos of Japan in the quarterfinals of the AFC Champions League Elite on Saturday.

title: 'There's no drop-off down there': How the bottom of the order is powering the Cubs' offense to top of MLB
content: Chicago has scored more runs than any team in the majors so far -- with the help of some unexpected sluggers.

title: Slow start? Not this year! Francisco Lindor has Mets rolling
content: After stumbling out of the gate last season, the star shortstop and his team are lighting up Citi Field.

title: Jim Schlossnagle is at the center of the Texas-Texas A&M storm
content: As if the Texas-Texas A&M rivalry needed more, Jim Schlossnagle's decision to switch rivals adds all the extra drama.

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: 2025 NFL draft: Fantasy football analysis of Rounds 1-3
content: Liz Loza, Matt Bowen and Mike Clay break down the fantasy potential of early-round rookies from the NFL draft and provide initial 2025 projections.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Spurs, Chelsea, Newcastle battling for Guéhi
content: Crystal Palace centre-back Marc Guéhi is a man in demand ahead of the summer transfer window. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Can’t wait forever’: Pregnant wife of BSF jawan in Pak custody hunts for answers
content: Rajani, wife of BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw detained by Pakistan Rangers, plans to travel to Firozpur and potentially Delhi to seek information about her husband's well-being after 72 hours of silence. Despite being pregnant and initial discouragement, she received permission to travel, fueled by anxiety after seeing a photograph of a blindfolded Purnam released by Pakistan. State government officials have assured the family of their support in pursuing the case with the Centre.

title: From student to terrorist: How Adil became mastermind of J&K attack
content: Adil Hussain Thokar, once a promising student from Anantnag, is now suspected of masterminding the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists. He reportedly traveled to Pakistan, became radicalized, and re-entered India to carry out the assault. His family claims he has been missing since 2018, but authorities believe he is a key figure in the attack, offering a reward for his arrest.

title: 'Combat ready': Indian Navy test fires anti-ship missile in Arabian Sea
content: The Indian Navy successfully conducted anti-ship missile firings, demonstrating its readiness to safeguard maritime interests amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack. INS Surat, the latest indigenous guided missile destroyer, also test-fired the MR-SAM system, enhancing defense capabilities.

title: Tesla CEO Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been...'
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Several dead at Vancouver festival, driver arrested: What we know so far
content: A tragic incident occurred at the Lapu Lapu Day Block Party in Vancouver, where a vehicle struck a crowd, resulting in multiple fatalities and injuries. The Vancouver Police have apprehended the driver and are currently investigating the event that took place during the Filipino community's celebration.

title: 'Nalayak ho nikamme ho': Ex-Pak cricketer blames Indian Army for Pahalgam attack
content: Former Pakistani cricketer Shahid Afridi has sparked controversy by blaming the Indian Army's "incompetence" for the Pahalgam terror attack, citing their inability to provide security despite a large presence in Kashmir. He criticized the Indian media's coverage and accused some Indian cricketers of baselessly blaming Pakistan.

title: Bill Gates explains why he didn't fund daughter's new Phia shopping app
content: Bill Gates did not fund his daughter Phoebe's new shopping app, Phia. He provided guidance on personnel matters instead. Phoebe launched the AI-powered app with Sophia Kianni. The app helps users compare prices across retailers. It also promotes sustainable shopping.

title: Sunrisers Hyderabad team jets off to Maldives after their win over CSK
content: Following their crucial victory against Chennai Super Kings, Sunrisers Hyderabad has embarked on a brief retreat to the Maldives. The team's win at Chepauk has revitalized their playoff aspirations, breaking a long-standing losing streak at the venue. Looking ahead, Sunrisers will face Gujarat Titans on May 2, aiming to continue their winning momentum and secure a coveted playoff spot.

title: Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: 'Pahalgam perpetrators will be punished': Top quotes from PM Modi's 'Mann Ki Baat'
content: In his monthly radio address 'Mann Ki Baat,' Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed grief over the Pahalgam terror attack, conveying condolences to the bereaved families. He affirmed India's unwavering dedication to combating terrorism, noting global leaders' condemnation of the attack and solidarity with India.

title: Trump’s top security chief lost her $4,400 Gucci purse — who stole it and how
content: A masked thief has been apprehended for stealing Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's Gucci handbag, containing cash, passport, and confidential documents, from a DC restaurant. The suspect, believed to be part of an East Coast gang specializing in high-end thefts, executed the crime while Noem dined with family, despite the presence of Secret Service agents.

title: 'Pak will be brought to its knees': Hardeep Singh warns over Pahalgam attack
content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri strongly condemned Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, asserting that the nation would face severe consequences for its actions. He highlighted Pakistan's declining state and its use of terrorism as state policy. India has taken decisive diplomatic actions, including suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, signaling a firm response to cross-border terrorism.

title: Shah Rukh Khan to make his historic Met Gala debut with Sabyasachi
content: Bollywood's King Khan, Shah Rukh Khan, is set to make his grand debut at the Met Gala 2025, marking a historic moment for Indian representation. He will collaborate with celebrated designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee, promising a legendary fusion of Indian craftsmanship and global celebrity. The theme, "Superfine: Tailoring Black Style," sets the stage for a night of unparalleled fashion.

title: ‘Surrender so we can live in peace': Mother of Pahalgam attack terrorist
content: In J&K's Anantnag, Shahzada Bano's house was demolished after her son, Adil Hussain Thoker, was named a suspect in the Pahalgam attack. Adil's family claims no contact since 2018, when he left for an exam. Bano pleads for his surrender. Security forces searched the home before demolition, detaining Adil's father, brothers, and cousins. Neighbors recall Adil as a dedicated student.

title: Bill Maher torches Trump: 'Flirting with dictatorship doesn’t stay flirting'
content: Weeks after a cordial dinner, Bill Maher sharply criticized Donald Trump, cautioning against his flirtation with authoritarianism. Maher referenced Trump's past remarks about exceeding term limits and joked about being a dictator, warning that such jokes can become reality. Despite some conservative support for his anti-wokeness stance, Maher made it clear that his dinner with Trump wouldn't silence his concerns about Trump's potential authoritarian tendencies.

title: FIITJEE siphoned off Rs 250cr, failed to deliver quality edu services: ED
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating FIIT-JEE for financial irregularities and failure to provide promised educational services. Searches revealed the institute collected ₹250 crore from 15,000 students, diverting funds to personal properties and leaving faculty salaries unpaid. Numerous coaching centers were abruptly closed, leading to widespread distress and police FIRs.

title: 'India will hunt down terror': Himanta slams Bilawal Bhutto's remarks
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma condemned Bilawal Bhutto Zardari's remarks against India. Sarma stated that such statements disrespect Bilawal's family sacrifices. India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty. This action follows a terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir. The Cabinet Committee on Security, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, made the decision.

title: Usha Vance not the only high achiever in family- Meet lesser-known sister
content: Usha Vance, an Indian-American, is gaining prominence alongside her husband, US Vice President JD Vance. While Usha navigates political life, her sister, Shreya Chilukuri, excels in engineering. A Duke University graduate, Shreya contributed to missile development at Raytheon and now works at ASML, a leading semiconductor company.

title: Why did Trump's, Prince William's attire at Pope Francis' funeral raise eyebrows?
content: A sartorial stir erupted at Pope Francis's farewell, as dignitaries seemingly veered from Vatican tradition. Donald Trump, Prince William, and Joe Biden donned blue hues, contrasting with the customary black attire for such events.

title: Pahalgam attack: Houses of 3 more terrorists demolished in crackdown
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, authorities in Jammu and Kashmir have intensified their crackdown on terrorism by demolishing the houses of three more active terrorists in Bandipora, Pulwama, and Shopian districts. These actions bring the total number of demolitions to nine, targeting individuals involved in terror activities and linked to groups like Lashkar-e-Taiba.

title: Fire breaks out at ED's Mumbai office, no injuries reported
content: A fire erupted at approximately 2:30 am on Sunday in Mumbai's Kaiser-I-Hind building, which houses the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office. The fire, confined to the fourth floor of the five-story building, prompted a Level-II emergency response. Firefighters deployed multiple resources, including fire engines and tankers, to contain the blaze, and the cause of the fire remains under investigation.

title: '130 missiles kept for India': Pakistan min's open threat over Pahalgam attack
content: Amid escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistani minister Hanif Abbasi threatened India with nuclear retaliation, asserting that 130 missiles are aimed at India. Abbasi's statement followed India's diplomatic actions, including expelling Pakistani officials and halting the Indus Waters Treaty, after the deadly Pahalgam attack that killed 26.

title: IPL match today: MI vs LSG - all you need to know
content: Mumbai Indians, riding on a four-game winning streak, face Lucknow Super Giants in a crucial IPL mid-table clash. Both teams are tied at 10 points, battling for a top spot. Mumbai's key players like Rohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya are in top form, while Lucknow relies on their overseas stars.

title: J&K terror attack: Pakistan, backed by China, dilutes UNSC statement
content: The UN Security Council condemned the Pahalgam attack in Jammu & Kashmir, but Pakistan, supported by China, worked to dilute the statement's phrasing. Unlike the Pulwama attack condemnation, which urged cooperation with the Indian government, the Pahalgam statement only mentioned "all relevant authorities." This change followed tough negotiations, with Pakistan likely seeking to avoid giving India leverage in investigations.

title: De-weeding operation at Bengaluru lake throws up refrigerator
content: A de-weeding operation at Bengaluru's Madiwala Lake uncovered a shocking amount of waste, including a refrigerator. The Jaldost team, using NAL's technology, has removed over 20 tonnes of garbage. Locals criticize BBMP's waste management and lack of lake monitoring. NAL highlights the potential for biomass reuse, but BBMP's slow waste removal raises concerns about environmental neglect.

title: 'Evils of terrorism': FBI offers India 'full support' after J&K attack
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, FBI Director Kash Patel assured India of continued support, echoing sentiments from top US leaders like President Trump and Vice President Vance. They condemned the attack and reaffirmed solidarity with India in combating terrorism.

title: Russia for first time confirms North Korean troops fighting in Ukraine war
content: In a significant admission, Russia confirmed North Korean military personnel are fighting alongside its forces in Ukraine, validating claims from Zelenskyy and South Korea. Valery Gerasimov reported to Putin that North Korean soldiers provided substantial support, operating under a strategic alliance. Putin praised his forces' success in the Kursk region.

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire for third night, Indian Army responds effectively
content: Pakistani troops have violated the ceasefire agreement for the third consecutive night by initiating unprovoked firing along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir. Indian Army soldiers responded effectively with small arms fire in the Tutmari Gali and Rampur sectors.

title: India’s sudden Jhelum water release sparks panic in PoK
content: A sudden surge in the Jhelum river, allegedly due to India's unnotified water release from the Uri Dam, has triggered chaos in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. This abrupt discharge led to a water emergency in Hattian Bala, forcing residents to evacuate. Pakistani authorities have condemned the action as a violation of the Indus Waters Treaty, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: Fearing hit-back, LeT proxy does U-turn, says no hand in Pahalgam attack
content: The Resistance Front (TRF), a Lashkar-e-Taiba proxy, retracted its claim of responsibility for the Pahalgam terror attack, attributing it to a cyber intrusion. This denial follows international acceptance of India's stance that LeT, backed by Pakistan, was behind the attack. Security sources dismiss the retraction as a ludicrous damage control attempt by Pakistan's ISI to evade accountability.

title: Watch: Explosion at Iran's Shahid Rajaei port kills 14, over 700 injured
content: A massive explosion and fire at Iran's Shahid Rajaei port resulted in 14 fatalities and over 750 injuries. The incident, reportedly linked to a shipment of missile fuel chemicals, occurred near Bandar Abbas during nuclear negotiations with the US.

title: Was Trump sleeping at Pope Francis' funeral? Viral photos spark debate
content: Photos circulating on social media purportedly show Donald Trump sleeping during Pope Francis' funeral in Rome, sparking online criticism. Trump was seated alongside Melania Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Despite the controversy, Trump shared images from the funeral on Truth Social and met with Zelenskyy, commenting on the situation in Ukraine.

title: Judge 'not competent' to write verdict, Allahabad HC sends him for training
content: Allahabad High Court has expressed serious concerns regarding Additional District Judge Amit Verma's inability to write judgments. The court directed that Verma, from Kanpur Nagar, undergo three months of training at the Judicial Training and Research Institute in Lucknow. This decision came after the judge dismissed an amendment application with a brief, unsubstantiated order.

title: Hanuman Garhi temple's chief priest to break 300-yr tradition for Ram Temple visit
content: In a historic move, Ayodhya's Hanuman Garhi temple's chief priest, Mahant Prem Das, will break a 300-year-old tradition by visiting the Ram temple. This unprecedented event, permitted by religious bodies, will see Mahant Das leave Hanuman Garhi on April 30th in a grand procession featuring elephants, camels, and Naga Sadhus.

title: Jaat box office day 17: Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda starrer mints Rs 1.25 crore
content: Sunny Deol's film Jaat saw a rise in earnings on its third Saturday. It earned Rs 1.25 crore, a jump from Friday's Rs 85 lakh. The film faces competition from Akshay Kumar's Kesari Chapter 2. Jaat's total box office collection is Rs 82.85 crore. Sunny Deol has confirmed Jaat 2, promising it will be even better.

title: Trump demands ‘free’ transit for US ships through Panama, Suez canals
content: Donald Trump has urged for free passage for American military and commercial ships through the Panama and Suez Canals, directing Secretary of State Marco Rubio to act immediately. He highlighted the US's historical involvement in these waterways. This comes amid disruptions to Suez Canal traffic due to Houthi rebel attacks and escalating US military actions against them.

title: J&K: Post-attack, tourists start to reappear in Pahalgam
content: Despite a recent terrorist attack that killed 26 tourists, Pahalgam is gradually welcoming visitors again. Tourists are returning, drawn by the area's beauty and the absence of travel restrictions. Locals and security personnel are supportive, and businesses are offering discounts. While Baisaran meadow remains closed, other attractions are open, signaling a slow return to normalcy for the picturesque resort town.

title: 15 local cadres helped Pahalgam attackers: Probe
content: Indian authorities have identified fifteen local Kashmiri overground workers (OGWs) as suspects in facilitating the recent Pahalgam terror attack. Electronic surveillance revealed their potential involvement in logistics and arms procurement from Pakistan. Three prime suspects are detained, with police seeking two others.

title: Aligarh jail inmates clear UP Board exams with 100% success
content: Aligarh jail celebrated a remarkable 100% success rate as five inmates cleared their UPMSP board exams. Yogesh Pandey and Dharmendra Kumar passed the high school exams, while Netrapal Singh, Vishal Kumar, and Rajesh Kumar cleared the intermediate examinations. Prison officials expressed joy, highlighting the positive impact of education within the jail walls, offering a glimmer of hope for the inmates.

title: Centre bars live media coverage of defence operations
content: Citing past security breaches like the Kargil War and the 26/11 attack, the Centre has issued a strong advisory to media outlets, urging restraint in reporting defence operations. The advisory aims to prevent real-time coverage and source-based reporting that could compromise national security, especially amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack.

title: Pahalgam massacre: Ponywallahs quizzed by cops, being 're-verified'
content: Pahalgam police are re-verifying pony guides and locals. This follows the Baisaran meadow attack on April 22. Initial tourist statements and social media videos prompted the action. Twenty pony handlers are being questioned. Hundreds of pony owners were called for verification. Police are also verifying shawl sellers, Maggi vendors, and villagers near Baisaran. Even local police are recording statements.

title: Abandoned police station building turned into education centre in Jharkhand’s cybercrime hotspot Jamtara
content: “Equipped with Wi-Fi, a projector, and other facilities, the centre was opened at the old Police Station (PS) building in Karmatand, approximately 220 km from the State’s capital Ranchi,” a police official said

title: Makkalai Thedi Maruthuvam scheme hits the mark by improving hypertension, diabetes control in T.N.
content: Tamil Nadu’s MTM scheme has led to better health outcomes, with blood pressure management among adults improving by 17% and blood sugar levels by 16.7%

title: All Pakistani nationals in Maharashtra accounted for, arrangements made for deportation: Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis assures deportation of Pakistani nationals, denies any missing individuals in the state

title: Akhil Gogoi apologises for comment on pro-BJP Muslim voters
content: The Raijor Dal president and Sibsagar MLA said he should not have made such a statement as a progressive and rational person

title: Osmania General Hospital doctors perform intestine transplant on 40-year-old man
content: The patient underwent a major surgery to remove part of the small bowel and right colon and doctors confirmed that biopsy reports have shown no signs of the body rejecting the new intestine

title: Public Safety Act: Two suspected overground workers detained in Jammu & Kashmir’s Budgam
content: The Overground workers have been identified as Tahir Ahmad Kumar, a resident of Pakerpora and Shabir Ahmad Ganai, a resident of Karpora Pakerpora

title: Indian Navy carries out anti-ship firing drills
content: The firing drills came amid heightened tensions between India and Pakistan over the Pahalgam terror attack

title: SC to hear plea to prohibit sexually explicit content on OTT, social media platforms on April 28
content: The plea has sought laying down of guidelines constituting a National Content Control Authority to prohibit sexually explicit content on these platforms

title: Indian goods worth $10 billion annually reach Pakistan via third countries: GTRI estimates
content: GTRI Founder it helps firms to bypass India-Pakistan trade restrictions; sell goods at higher prices, using the third country route; and avoid scrutiny, since the trade appears to come from other countries

title: W.B. school recruitment crisis: Mamata offers aid to non-teaching staff, but protesters refuse to budge
content: West Bengal CM says monthly financial assistance will be provided to Group C and D employees till the Supreme Court announces decision on State’s review petition

title: Suvendu visits Murshidabad, offers compensation to two from a family killed in violence
content: Meanwhile, the West Bengal government issued a notification announcing the transfer of key police officials of the Murshidabad Police District and Jangipur Police District, where the violence unfolded.

title: Polavaram being sidelined for the sake of Banakacherla project, says Sharmila
content: The APCC chief demands a fresh survey for relief and rehabilitation of Polavaram project-displaced families as the one done is fraught with mistakes

title: Mann Ki Baat | PM Modi says harshest response awaits perpetrators of Pahalgam attack
content: PM Modi said the attack showed the “desperation of the patrons of terrorism” and displayed their “cowardice”

title: 25 Dead, 750 Injured In Iran Port Fire, Blast Heard 50 Km Away: 10 Points
content: Smoke shrouded Iran's largest commercial port and surrounding areas as a fire following a major blast killed 25 people and injured 750 so far. Strong winds posed hindrances to firefighting operations.

title: In 'Mann Ki Baat', PM Modi's Big Message Over Pahalgam Attack
content: Every Indian's blood is boiling and each one of them is feeling the pain of those who lost their own in the terror attack at Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam on Tuesday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said today, appealing to the country to remain united

title: Pahalgam Attack Updates: “Terrorists, Their Patrons Want Kashmir To Be Destroyed Again,” Says PM Modi
content: Pahalgam terror attack updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan have soared after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir left 26 people dead this week.

title: Several Killed After Car Rams Crowd At Festival In Canada's Vancouver
content: Several deaths are being reported from the Canadian city of Vancouver after a driver ran over a crowd at a street festival. The local police said the incident occurred around 8 pm (local time). The driver has been taken into custody by the police.

title: India's "Combat-Ready" Warships Carry Out Missile Firings In Arabian Sea
content: Indian warships have conducted multiple anti-ship firings in the Arabian Sea, demonstrating their preparedness for long-range precision strikes, with the Navy asserting they are combat-ready to protect the nation's interests.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Are US And Taliban Drawing Up A 'Secret' Deal?
content: Against the labyrinthine workings of Afghan politics, the Americans are demanding weapons handover or control over Bagram.

title: Man Who Shot At Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan In 2022 Jailed For Life
content: Imran Khan suffered bullet injuries on his right leg during the assassination attempt by two shooters during a political rally in Punjab province's Wazirabad area.

title: A Trump-Zelensky Meet At Vatican Basilica, Then A "Dealt With" Jab At Putin
content: US President Donald Trump has raised doubts about his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin's willingness to end the war in Ukraine. Trump suggested Putin has been "tapping me along" and said the Russian leader "has to be dealt with differently."

title: "Tu Abhi Bhi...": Adnan Sami's Comeback To Pak Ex Minister's Balloon Dig
content: Reacting to an X post on New Delhi setting a deadline for Pakistan nationals to leave India, Fawad Ahmed Hussain Chaudhry, a former minister from the Imran Khan-led Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, took a dig at Adnan Sami

title: "Evils Of Terrorism": FBI Chief Kash Patel Condemns Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: FBI Chief Kash Patel described the deadly assault as a "reminder of the constant threats our world faces from the evils of terrorism."

title: US Deports 3 American Children, Including Cancer Patient: Rights Groups
content: Three American children aged two, four and seven -- one of whom has a rare form of cancer -- have been deported from the United States alongside their undocumented immigrant mothers.

title: Anti-Terror Agency NIA Takes Over Pahalgam Case, Meets Victims' Families
content: The NIA took over the case five days after the incident and four days after its team visited the Pahalgam terror attack site.

title: Maligned By Trump, White House Reporters Hold Subdued Annual Gala
content: The White House Correspondents' Association staged its annual gala in a muted celebration amid mounting concerns about press freedom under Trump.

title: Trump's Agenda For Next 100 Days: Trade Deals, Peace Talks, 'Torpedoes'
content: President Donald Trump and his administration this week will highlight the accomplishments of his first 100 days in office, while looking toward the next 100 days.

title: A Look At Pope Francis's Family: "Not Religious" Niece, Footballer Great-Nephew
content: As the world bid farewell to Pope Francis, here's a look at the family he leaves behind - the ones who knew him simply as Jorge.

title: Pakistan Provokes India Again With Firings Across Line Of Control
content: The situation remains tense along the Line of Control, the military control boundary in Jammu and Kashmir, with the Pakistan Army trying to provoke the Indian troops with regular cross-border firings in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 10 Terrorists' Homes In Kashmir Razed Amid Crackdown After Pahalgam Attack
content: Homes of 10 terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir have been turned into rubble as India cracks down hard in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack that left 25 tourists and a Kashmiri dead

title: More than 15,000 cases booked for consumption of alcohol in public places: SP
content: Speaking to The Hindu in Vizianagaram, Vizianagaram SP Vakul Jindal said 15,578 petty cases were booked against such persons, and they were released after paying the statutory fines in the court

title: Punjab Police busts weapon-smuggling module with links to Pakistan
content: Seven pistols, four live cartridges and ₹1.50 lakh have allegedly been recovered from the arrested accused

title: 10 militants arrested in valley districts of Manipur
content: More than 250 people have been killed and thousands rendered homeless in ethnic violence in Manipur over the last two years

title: Maharashtra Minority Commission chief slams Nitesh Rane over hate speech remarks
content: Maharashtra State Minority Commission Chairman Pyare Khan also stressed on the support of the Muslim community for the country, particularly in the light of recent terrorist attacks

title: Pahalgam terror attack | Nearly 80% tourist bookings to Kashmir cancelled
content: ‘It is justified and natural given what happened,’ Kashmir Hotel Association head says against the backdrop of a badly hit tourism industry in J&K

title: Pahalgam tragedy: Are unresolved questions of Partition reflected in attack, asks Mani Shankar Aiyar
content: “There was the partition of 1971, when more than half of Pakistan’s population and a very important part of its territory deliberately moved away from it on the ground that it was not enough to be Muslim and it was also necessary to be Bengali,” Mani Shankar Aiyar said

title: Pahalgam terror attack: NIA takes over probe
content: The NIA said that its teams, which have been camping at the terror attack site, have intensified the search for evidence at Pahalgam’s Baisaran

title: In frames| A town that weaves gold
content: Balaramapuram in Kerala holds a rich history going back to its roots in the princely state of Travancore and has secured a unique brand name for its handloom textiles

title: FBI Director Kash Patel condemns Pahalgam terror attack, assures ‘full support’ to India
content: FBI Director condemns Pahalgam terrorist attack, pledges full support to India, highlighting global threat of terrorism

title: Congress’ balancing act: Nationalism, terrorism, and the politics of response
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge, a day after the Pahalgam attack, stated, “This is not a time for partisan politics”

title: Major blaze breaks out at ED office building in Mumbai; firefighting ops continue for over six hours
content: There were no reports of casualties in the fire that broke out at the Kaiser-I-Hind building in the Ballard Estate area, officials said

title: Interview | Community participation and digital innovation vital for universal immunisation: UNDP India chief
content: UNDP supports India’s immunisation programme, reaching millions annually, with digital platforms and community initiatives for universal coverage

title: Film directors Khalid Rahman, Ashraf Hamsa arrested on the charge of possessing suspected hybrid ganja
content: The Excise Department arrests film directors, Khalid Rahman and Ashraf Hamsa, for suspected ganja possession in Kochi, released on bail due to minimal quantity

title: All Pakistani nationals left Bihar ahead of April 27 deadline: Officials
content: A total of 19 Pakistani nationals, who came to different districts of Bihar on visit visas and tourist visas left the State on April 25 or before that, as per data provided by the State government

title: Maharashtra govt planning water metro for Mumbai, Kochi body to help with DPR: Nitesh Rane
content: Highlighting the tourism potential of the ambitious initiative, Mr. Rane said a separate project may be taken up to develop Vasai Fort as a tourist destination

title: Environment Minister announces ₹24 crore to improve climate literacy
content: The Minister said the bio-shield programme would be expanded at a cost of ₹8.45 crore to protect coastal habitats from severe impact of climate change and rehabilitate them

title: After Pope Francis's Funeral, All Eyes Turn To Conclave
content: Cardinals will gather in the Sistine Chapel to elect a successor to Pope Francis in a highly secretive process that could take several days, potentially longer.

title: Doves, Deaths And Rations: Papal Elections Over Time
content: Cardinals electing Pope Francis's successor will have an easier time than many of their predecessors, who endured spartan conditions and were even locked up so long that some of them died.

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE updates: NIA takes over probe; Kapil Sibal says parties should demand special Parliament session
content: J&K Police have stepped up operations against local militants and their supporters and have detained 175 in Anantnag district.

title: CPI(M) team inspects lands allotted to Central institutions in Amaravati
content: More than 300 acres have been provided to 41 institutions or departments, but there has been little progress in the construction works, says Baburao

title: Eight injured as private bus overturns in Palnadu district
content: Negligence of the driver led to the accident, and swift action by police and local residents saved the lives of passengers, says SP

title: SSC results reflect progress in digital pedagogy introduced for children with special needs in A.P., says inclusion specialist
content: This year’s highest score has touched 90.8% and a majority of the children with special needs have crossed 85% marks, he claims

title: YSRCP activist found murdered in Kurnool district
content: Venkateswarlu was involved in the finance business and differences in the business might be the reason for the murder. He was not having any political differences.

title: What’s the reason for targeting Simla Agreement? | Explained
content: Why is Pakistan threatening to hold the 1972 agreement in abeyance? What are the implications? Haven’t both sides reneged on the terms they had agreed on? What will happen to the Line of Control? What are the other agreements that could be put on hold?

title: Meghalaya to host Strawberry Festival in May
content: Cycling, trekking, glamping and workshops on wine-making and organic farming to be part of agro-tourism initiative

title: The Resistance Front | New face of terror
content: The group, which emerged on the militancy landscape of Jammu and Kashmir in 2019, has a well-trained cadre that has carried out targeted killings in the Valley

title: Indus Waters Treaty | Storm beneath the waters
content: The 1960 agreement, which India has put in ‘abeyance’ after the Pahalgam terror attack, had started showing signs of decay in recent years with New Delhi demanding a bilateral modification of the treaty

title: Waqf amendment a political issue, not a Muslim issue, says Thangal
content: Waqf (Amendment) Act part of an anti-Muslim agenda aimed at curbing the religious freedom of the community and destroying the country’s pluralistic and secular policies, says resolution

title: Nainar Nagenthran | Man on a mission
content: The BJP’s new president in Tamil Nadu, an old AIADMK hand, seeks to build on the momentum his predecessor, Annamalai, created

title: NHAI starts work to raise height of retaining walls on bridges along Chennai-Bengaluru NH
content: Move comes after 71-year-old rider fell off the bridge near the Collectorate a week ago after he lost control of his vehicle upon hitting the bridge’s retaining wall. The total height of retaining walls will be increased to five feet, say officials

title: HC frowns upon top govt. officials for resisting steps taken by its retired judge to fill up Pachaiyappa’s college faculty vacancies
content: Justice Bharatha Chakravarthy says, he finds an orchestrated and concerted effort to overreach the orders passed by the first Division Bench of the High Court

title: Requiem mass offered to Pope Francis in Vijayawada
content: Bishop Rajarao and others pay tribute to Pope Francis for his reforms and messages of peace worldwide

title: T.N. government pays ₹1 lakh to lawyer subjected to custodial torture
content: It also instructs DGP to initiate disciplinary action against nine police personnel involved in human rights violations

title: BBMP polls likely to be delayed beyond October
content: If everything goes according to plan, the BBMP elections may be conducted before the end of 2025, says Transport and Muzrai Minister Ramalinga Reddy

title: West Bengal CM announces compensation for tourists killed in Pahalgam, fallen soldier in J&K
content: Thousands of people the join final journey of Army Havildar Jhantu Ali Sheikh who was killed in the line of duty in Udhampur in Jammu and Kashmir on April 24

title: Saving Sillahalla, the proposed hydroelectric project site in the Nilgiris
content: The proposed Sillahalla Pumped Storage Hydroelectric Project has run into rough weather as local residents have come out to protest, fearing the impact of such a large-scale project on their lives and livelihood. Rohan Premkumar spends some time with them to find out what exactly bothers the villagers

title: The Hindu EducationPlus Career Counselling kicks off in Bengaluru, gets massive response
content: As many as 40 higher educational institutions, including private medical and engineering colleges, banks, and around 1,200 students and parents participate

title: Remote block along LoC in J&K connected by all-weather roads for the first time
content: Khwas has recorded zero incidents of terrorism in the past one year, says Rajouri Deputy Commissioner, citing the terrain and its remoteness as among the factors for high incidence of terrorism in the area

title: Former Kaleshwaram ENC B. Hari Ram arrested following raids at 14 locations linked to him
content: The arrest follows raids conducted at his residence and 13 other locations linked to him and his family that led to seizure of a catalogue of properties and luxury items

title: Supreme Court confirms CBI probe into the mysterious death of former Andhra MP’s close confidant
content: ‘Once an FIR is registered and investigation has taken place, direction for a CBI probe is not open to challenge’

title: Modi government’s tough stance on terrorism will shake Pakistan: Bandi Sanjay
content: This is a government that delivers on its promises, the Minister said pointing out that 10 lakh jobs were filled through ‘Rozgar Mela’

title: Tell him to get his mental condition checked: Union Minister Hardeep Puri slams Bilawal Bhutto Zardari’s comments on Indus
content: “Enough is enough... We will no longer tolerate this,” says Mr. Puri; responding to the Pakistani leader’s message to India that “either this water will flow from this Indus or your blood”

title: BJP MLA booked for hurting religious sentiments after high drama at Jaipur mosque
content: Balmukund Acharya, his supporters, and a large number of BJP leaders and workers allegedly raised offensive slogans at the Jama Masjid in the Walled City; the FIR said they threatened to kill Muslims

title: ‘Why has India’s feminist movement not spoken on Savitribai Phule as yet?’: Kancha Ilaiah
content: BJP, RSS have been trying to renegotiate with Phule, Ambedkar; BJP can’t afford to upset the OBCs, says Kancha Ilaiah Shepherd

title: Jignesh Mevani calls upon people to open ‘Samvidhan Shakhas’ to counter RSS
content: Samvidhana Samrakshakara Samavesha held in Davanagere resolves to have an army of one lakh people to defend the Indian constitution in three years

title: Thousands participated in mega job fair in Thrissur
content: Interviews conducted for around 35,000 job opportunities across 577 different sectors, offered by 151 employers

title: ‘Janivara’ issue: Karnataka High Court issues notice to State government, KEA
content: The petitioner sought direction to initiate stringent action against officials who prevented students from entering examination halls to write CET.

title: Demetrius Knight Jr. puts delivery driver past in rear view with draft pick
content: demetrius Knight Jr. was in tears when he got the call from the Cincinnati Bengals . the 25-year-old is only a couple months older than new teammate Ja'Marr Chase . he played at three different schools and finished his six-year college career with the south Carolina G20 .

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: Sorting through draft overreactions on Sanders, Cousins, Giants, Jags and Steelers
content: the 2025 draft featured an entire sub-industry of overreaction around one particular player who ended up being the 144th pick by the Browns . the discourse was on fire when the second and third rounds ended Friday night and Sanders still hadn't been drafted .

title: As it happened: Chris Eubank Jr. bests Conor Benn in grudge match
content: Chis Eubank Jr. and Conor Benn face-off after the final press conference before their fight. (3:06) Follow live updates from 9 p.m. BST as Chris Eubank Jr. faces Conor Benn on Saturday night at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in North London. In Thursday's press conference Eubank Jr. spoke of his  "pain" to cut his weight , and in Friday's weigh-in he was  fined $500,000  for missing the 160 pound weight limit. Find out all the information on the  Eubank-Benn rivalry .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Injured Rashford's season could be over - Emery
content: Marcus Rashford missed aston villa's 3-0 defeat to crystal palace . the forward picked up an injury that "could rule him out for the rest of the season" the news comes as a blow to Villa's hopes of a top-five finish in the premier league .

title: Who Is Hussein Al-Sheikh, Front-Runner To Succeed Palestinian President Abbas
content: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on Saturday appointed his close aide,  Hussein al-Sheikh , as the first-ever vice president of the Palestine Liberation Organisation (PLO). While the appointment does not guarantee al-Sheikh's succession to the presidency, it positions him as the leading candidate among veteran politicians in the dominant Fatah party.
